static final DateFormat dateISOformat

Detailed Description

A simple implementation of logging, that outputs to stderr with time stamps.

Version:
Id
CollectorLog.java,v 1.5 2005/04/08 12:48:10 guyg Exp

com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::CollectorLog (  String  linePrefix  )  [inline]
 

The constructor.

Parameters:
linePrefix A string to prefix on each output line (handy for things such as the "progress" callback for CollectorSetupManager, to allow distinguishing a set of log outputs). 
00040                                            {
00041         this.linePrefix = linePrefix;
00042         Package pkg = this.getClass().getPackage();
00043         if (pkg == null) {
00044             pkgPrefix = "";
00045         } else {
00046             pkgPrefix = pkg.getName() + ".";
00047             // JDK 1.4: replace all "." is pkg name by "\\.",
00048             //   and Pattern.compile() the result.
00049         }
00050     }

synchronized void com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::logWriteX (  String  level,
String  className,
String  function,
String  msg
)  [inline, protected]
 

The utility for outputting a single message.

Parameters:
level The level ("debug", " info", etc.).
className The class name.
function The function (method).
msg The message. 
00117                                                                                                        {
00118         synchronized(dateISOformat) {
00119             String classNameFull = className;
00120             if (msg == null) { msg = ""; }
00121             if (function == null) { function = ""; }
00122             if (className == null) { className = ""; }
00123 
00124             // Not much point in the following commented out stuff
00125             // because Class.forName() requires a fully-qualified name
00126             // (e.g., "com.xacct.CRANE.receiver.CollectorThread")
00127             // try {
00128             //     classNameFull = Class.forName(className).getName();
00129             // } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
00130             //     classNameFull = "**(" + e + ")**" + className;
00131             // }
00132 
00133             String date = dateISOformat.format(new Date());
00134             if (true) {
00135                 // XXX JDK 1.4: className = pkgPrefixPattern.matcher(className).replaceFirst("");
00136                 if (className.startsWith(pkgPrefix)) {
00137                     className = className.substring(pkgPrefix.length());
00138                 }
00139                 // Upper-case first character of message, for consistency.
00140                 if (msg.length() > 0 && Character.isLowerCase(msg.charAt(0))) {
00141                     msg = Character.toUpperCase(msg.charAt(0)) + msg.substring(1);
00142                 }
00143                 printerrln(this.linePrefix +
00144                            ":" + date.substring(date.length() - 2) + " " + // hh:mm:ss -- leave date off for compactness
00145                            ((level != INFO_TAG && level != DEBUG_TAG) ? ("[" + level + "] ") : "") +
00146                            msg + " :: " + function + "[" + className + "] " + date);
00147             } else {
00148                 boolean firstLine = true;
00149                 int offset = 0;
00150                 while (offset < msg.length()) {
00151                     if (firstLine) {
00152                         printerr(linePrefix +
00153                             date +
00154                             " " + level +
00155                             "[" + classNameFull + "." + function + "] thread " +
00156                             Thread.currentThread().getName());
00157                     } else {
00158                         printerr(linePrefix +
00159                             blanksOfLength(date) +
00160                             " " + blanksOfLength(level) +
00161                             " " + blanksOfLength(classNameFull) +
00162                             " " + blanksOfLength(function) + "  thread " +
00163                             Thread.currentThread().getName());
00164                     }
00165 
00166                     printerr("\t... ");
00167                     int nl = msg.indexOf('\n', offset);
00168                     if (nl < 0) {
00169                         printerrln(msg.substring(offset));
00170                         offset = msg.length();
00171                     } else {
00172                         printerrln(msg.substring(offset, nl - 1));
00173                         offset = nl + 1;
00174                     }
00175                     firstLine = false;
00176                 }
00177             }
00178         }
00179     }

        CollectorUtil.factoryDateFormat()
Date format for generating ISO-format dates (for suitable synchronization)

final String com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::INFO_TAG = " info" [private]
 

int com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::level = 1 [private]
 

The output level (default: info). Values are:
0: debug
1: info
2: warning
3: error
4: fatal a

String com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::linePrefix [private]
 

Line prefix (handy for things such as the "progress" callback for CollectorSetupManager.

String com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::pkgPrefix = "" [private]
 

The package prefix to remove from messages. This is set by the constructor to this package's name, followed by "." (e.g., "<code>com.xacct.CRANE.collector.</code>").

XXX With JDK 1.4, this should be replaced by a Pattern, and the pattern should be set by something like Pattern.compile("<code>^com\\.xacct\\.CRANE\\.collector\\.</code>").

final String com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorLog::WARN_TAG = " warn" [private]
